intro: Thesium robynsii, commonly known as the Robyn's thesium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its erect, sparsely branched stems. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense, spike-like inflorescences. Its leaves are linear and often covered with fine hairs. Thesium robynsii is typically found in rocky or sandy soils in arid or semi-arid regions.
